page.title: 18 HOUSES
page.content: There is a mixture of architecture in Sedgeberrow village, including several black and white cottages both thatched and tiled; terraces of Victorian villas; 1 or 2 houses built of stone; a Georgian house as well as the modern late 20th century buildings. There is a small brick house opposite the site of the old school where the school teacher used to live. There is a large black and white farmhouse, the oldest part of which is more than 400 years old. Next door to this is Church House, the oldest part of which was built in 1322. This was used as a chapel by a hermit monk whose gravestone is incorporated in the flagstones of the hallway.
